duties_responsibilities.duty: Demonstrate leadership in specialized clinical expertise and communication within a specialty area of practice.
Provide direct involvement with clinical training and in-service education, recognizing the need for help by others and providing clinical guidance to enhance performance.
Assist in identifying new programmatic needs to respond to changing patient care needs and the healthcare delivery system.
Enhance case management responsibilities for patients within the unit to improve throughput, recognizing patient needs for discharge.
Work in conjunction with staff and management on performance improvement and clinical research projects benefiting the unit and/or the department.
Assist in developing goals, standards, and evaluation criteria for performance improvement projects.
Collect data, solicit feedback from staff, and provide recommendations for performance improvement projects with regards to clinical practice to enhance outcomes.
Suggest ideas, methodology, and rationale for research projects and participate directly in the collection of data and monitoring of the project.
Submit articles for publication or presentation at clinical conferences.
Provide direct involvement with clinical training of staff and interns, preparing and presenting educational information for various audiences.
Develop resource material to enhance the quality and scope of patient care, and coordinate patient care in the area of specialized clinical expertise.
Assist in evaluations and development of treatment plans for patients, providing feedback to staff and identifying new equipment that will enhance patient care.
Assist with equipment and unit maintenance, performing other duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Advanced Degree in Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, or Speech-Language Pathology.
Clinical Specialist Certification in area of expertise.
